title: ML Fundamentals
content:
HUJI Understanding ML Concepts

Fundamental theoretical concepts from the HUJI book:

  • Empirical Risk Minimization: Learning as optimization
  • Generalization Bounds: Theoretical guarantees on learning performance
  • Bias-Complexity Tradeoff: Balancing model complexity with data fit

CS229 Core Algorithms

Essential algorithms from Stanford's course:

  • Supervised Learning: Linear models, SVMs, decision trees
  • Unsupervised Learning: Clustering, dimensionality reduction
  • Learning Theory: Bias-variance tradeoff, regularization

Paper Insights

Key concepts drawn from your AI/ML paper collection, providing both theoretical foundations and cutting-edge approaches.
